clinical_study.brief_title: Rapid Analysis of Infections by Spectrometry of Exhaled Breath
clinical_study.official_title: Exhaled Breath Analysis for Rapid Diagnosis in Opportunistic Respiratory Infections in Hematological Patients

brief_summary.textblock: To quantify the diagnostic, prognostic and therapeutic value of spectrometric analysis of exhaled breath from hematological patients with respiratory infection.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion (i.e. 6 weeks after diagnosis)
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy (expressed as specificity/sensitivity/NPV/PPV) will be assessed as compared to the revised EORTC-MSG criteria, at moment of diagnosis by high-resolution CT and bronchoscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic accuracy at 2 weeks as compared to the revised EORTC-MSG response criteria using high-resolution CT
Diagnostic accuracy at 2 weeks as compared to the revised EORTC-MSG response criteria using high-resolution CT

intervention.description: Spectrometric analysis of exhaled breath as screening for opportunistic respiratory infections

study_pop.textblock: Patients at high risk for opportunistic respiratory infections due to acute myeloid or lymphatic leukemia (undergoing intensive treatment), patients who underwent allogeneic stem cell transplantation, and patients receiving autologous stem cell transplantation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥ 18y at start of study
- One of the following diagnoses:
- De novo, refractory or relapsed AML/MDS receiving intensive chemotherapy
- De novo, refractory or relapsed ALL/T-lymphoblastic lymphoma receiving intensive chemotherapy
- Aplastic anemia requiring ATG therapy
- Any patient admitted for either autologous hematopoietic stem cell transplantation. Transplantation may not have been performed at time of enrolment.
- Any patient admitted with allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation within the last year, or planned during this admission.
- Written informed consent obtained from the patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hematological disease beyond the specified inclusion criteria
- Signs of active respiratory infection
- If previously enrolled: incomplete clearance of all signs of respiratory infection (both clinically, microbiologically and radiologically).
